title: Processes - Volume - Disc Method around y-Axis

content.question: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, the line <math alttext="y equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the curve <math alttext="y equals, 2 times the cube root of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mroot><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mroot></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the volume of the solid formed by revolving <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> about the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis?

topic.text: 8.9: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around the x- or y-Axis

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
